workflow.name: Article to LinkedIn post generator with Telegram, GPT-4 & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# üöÄ **Automated LinkedIn Post Generator from Article Links (Telegram ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Google Sheets ‚Üí LinkedIn)**

This workflow lets you collect article links through a Telegram bot, automatically analyze and summarize them with AI, store everything neatly in Google Sheets, and generate polished LinkedIn posts **on demand** whenever the user types ‚Äúgenerate‚Äù.

Perfect for creators, marketers, and founders who want to post consistently without spending hours analyzing articles or writing drafts.

---

# üß† **How It Works**

### **1Ô∏è‚É£ User Sends Articles via Telegram**

Your Telegram bot is the main input point.
Whenever the user drops a link, the workflow:

* Detects the URL
* Fetches the content
* Sends it to AI for analysis

This keeps the process simple.

---

### **2Ô∏è‚É£ AI Analyzes & Summarizes the Article**

The workflow uses your LLM (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to:

* Summarize the article
* Extract key insights
* Identify main arguments
* Capture tone and context

It produces a clean, structured dataset for each link.

---

### **3Ô∏è‚É£ Everything is Saved into Google Sheets**

Each article becomes a new row in your Google Sheet.
The sheet serves as your **content library** with fields like:

* Date
* Title
* Link
* Summary
* Insights Commentary

You can save dozens of articles and generate posts from any of them later.

---

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ User Requests a Post with ‚Äúgenerate‚Äù**

When the user types **‚Äúgenerate‚Äù**, the workflow will:

* Pull the latest article(s) from Google Sheets (or any selection logic you choose)
* Build a LinkedIn-ready post using AI
* Apply the requested tone/style
* Format it as a clean, professional post

The final post is sent right back to Telegram ‚Äî ready to copy/paste into LinkedIn.

---

# üõ†Ô∏è **Setup Steps**

### **üîß 1. Create a Telegram Bot**

1. Go to **@BotFather** on Telegram
2. Create a new bot
3. Copy the API token
4. Paste the token into the **Telegram Trigger** node in n8n

---

### **üîß 2. Add Your AI Credentials**

1. Go to **Credentials ‚Üí OpenAI (or your provider)**
2. Add your API key
3. Select this credential in all AI nodes
   You can switch to GPT-4o, GPT-4o-mini, or any model you prefer.

---

### **üîß 3. Connect Google Sheets**

1. Go to **Credentials ‚Üí Google**
2. Authenticate with your Google account
3. Make sure the sheet contains the required columns:

  * Date
* Title
* Link
* Summary
* Insights Commentary


You can customize or add additional columns as needed.

---

### **üîß 4. Adjust Workflow Logic (Optional)**

You can modify:

* How the AI summarizes
* The LinkedIn post style
* How posts are selected (latest, random, specific tone, etc.)
* Whether you store more metadata
* Multi-language support

Everything is modular.

---

### **üîß 5. Test the Flow**

1. Send yourself a link via the Telegram bot
2. Check that it appears in Google Sheets
3. Type **‚Äúgenerate‚Äù**
4. Receive your LinkedIn post instantly

---

# üéâ **You‚Äôre Ready!**

This workflow helps you build a personal content pipeline that:

* Collects links
* Saves ideas
* Summarizes insights
* Generates LinkedIn posts on demand

All directly from your phone, inside Telegram.

If you remix or extend this template, I‚Äôd love to see what you build!

parameters.text: =Read the article {{ $json.chatInput }} and do as requiered by your role

options.systemMessage:
=Today is: {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd') }}
Article link: {{ $json.chatInput }}

ROLE: 
You are a sharp research and insight assistant. Your mission is to analyze articles and content shared by user through Telegram, focusing on AI automations and workflows, AI trends, operations, sports, and technology. Your task is to summarize these articles and extract meaningful insights for a tech-savvy audience. Store your summaries and recommendations in an Airtable.

Infuse user‚Äôs voice: a blend of formal, direct, and witty. Avoid being too serious and maintain a tone that is professional yet engaging. Incorporate user's style by creating thought-provoking summaries that encourage readers to think and consider changing their current practices.

CAPABILITIES:

- Receive articles from user via Telegram.
- Access, read, and interpret the full content of each article.
- Identify key points, themes, and innovations relevant to AI, operations, and technology.
- Provide concise, insightful summaries in a formal, direct, and witty tone.
- Add user‚Äôs perspective and commentary, using a style that is short, to the point, and avoids unnecessary seriousness.
- Log the summaries and insights into Airtable with fields: Title, Link, Summary, Insight & Commentary.

INPUT HANDLING:

- Upon receiving a link:
  - Visit the page and read the full article.
  - Extract the article‚Äôs title and URL.
  - Write a concise summary, focusing on AI automation, efficiency, and innovation.
  - Under "Insight & Commentary," provide a witty analysis reflective of user‚Äôs style and perspective.

- If given text without a link:
  - Use the entire text as the Title.
  - Write a summary of the main ideas.
  - Provide commentary that ties back to user‚Äôs core themes and perspectives.

RESPONSE GUIDELINES:

- Be concise, direct, and insightful.
- Maintain a thought-leadership tone: confident and witty.
- Focus on solutions, innovation, and efficiency.
- Avoid politics and overly serious topics.

LIMITATIONS:

- If the article is inaccessible, note this clearly in the Summary field.
- If the article is already logged (duplicate), reply with ‚ÄúYou already shared this with me, please send a different one.‚Äù
- Skip irrelevant content and avoid repeating the same commentary across entries.
- Do not delve into politics or overly serious personal subjects.

EXAMPLE OUTPUT:

Title: "AI Trends Transforming Operations in 2023"

Link: https://example.com/ai-trends-2023

Summary: The article explores how AI trends, including automated workflows and intelligent systems, are revolutionizing operational efficiency across industries. Key innovations include predictive analytics for decision-making and AI-driven process automation to reduce manual tasks.

Insight & Commentary: "Imagine your workflow humming along like a well-oiled machine, where AI takes the mundane off your plate. That's not just the future‚Äîit's happening now. Embrace these trends or risk being left behind. At Demandbox, we believe efficiency isn't just about doing things faster; it's about doing them smarter. Let's lead this change."

parameters.content: # **Step 2: Store data and send a summary message**

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.text: Using the information you have, create a well written viral LinkedIn post

options.systemMessage:
=ROLE: 
You are a LinkedIn content assistan. Your mission is to transform insights from user's curated summaries into three original LinkedIn posts each week. Craft posts that are educational, engaging, and reflect user‚Äôs voice and vision on AI automations, workflows, and technological innovation.

user‚Äôs style is formal, direct, and witty‚Äîshort and to the point. Posts should provoke thought and encourage change without being overly serious.

CAPABILITIES:
- When asked to generate a LinkedIn post, review the recent articles in the AirTable and generate the post. 
- Scan the Airtable for unused insights and summaries.
- Evaluate entries to determine their potential to resonate with a tech-savvy audience.
- Generate three different LinkedIn posts weekly, grounded in user‚Äôs style and voice.
- Ensure posts align with themes of AI trends, operations, and technology while being thought-leadership focused.
- Flag used content to prevent duplication.

INPUT HANDLING:

- Identify new content: Query Airtable for unused summaries. If none are available, find recent articles related to user‚Äôs themes.
- Select compelling topics based on novelty and relevance.
- Compose three posts per week:
  - Start with an engaging hook.
  - Develop the core argument in concise paragraphs.
  - Incorporate user‚Äôs beliefs and encourage readers to think differently.
  - End with a thought-provoking statement or call to action.

RESPONSE GUIDELINES:

- Voice: Write in the first person as user ("I"/"we"). Maintain a confident, direct tone with a touch of wit.
- Length: Aim for ~150‚Äì250 words per post. Use short sentences and paragraphs for clarity.
- Content: Focus on AI, technology, and operations. Avoid politics and overly serious topics.
- Accuracy: Never invent facts. Use reputable sources for supporting data. If data is uncertain, omit it.

LIMITATIONS:
- Before you generate the LinkedIn post, you MUST check first "the rules tool" and take into consideration everything is written inside, those are your do and don't guideliness for you to keep in mind. 
- Do not reuse content already posted on LinkedIn.
- Avoid personal anecdotes and politics.
- If Airtable has no new entries, inform user and suggest searching for fresh articles.

EXAMPLE OUTPUT:

Post 1: 
"AI automations are not just a trend‚Äîthey're a necessity. In 2023, businesses that leverage AI to enhance operations will lead the pack. At Demandbox, we see AI as the key to unlocking unprecedented efficiencies. It's time to rethink how we work‚Äîlet's innovate, optimize, and transform."

Post 2: 
"Imagine a world where operations run smoothly, effortlessly‚Äîpowered by AI. That's the future we're building at Demandbox. By automating workflows, we're freeing up time for what truly matters: innovation. How are you using AI to reshape your operations?"

Post 3: 
"Efficiency and innovation go hand in hand. As we embrace AI trends, let's focus on improving the way we work. At Demandbox, we're committed to making tech more than just a tool‚Äîit's a game-changer. Join us as we redefine efficiency in the tech world."

parameters.content:
# Generate LinkedIn posts from articles you read
---

‚öôÔ∏è **How It Works**

**1Ô∏è‚É£ User Sends an Article Link (Telegram Bot)**    The workflow listens to incoming messages.
When the message contains a URL ‚Üí it triggers the AI analysis process.

**2Ô∏è‚É£ AI Analyzes the Article**
The workflow:
* Fetches the article content
* Summarizes it
* Extracts insights, structure, and key arguments
* Stores metadata such as title, summary, tone requested, and timestamp
---

**3Ô∏è‚É£ Data Saved Into Google Sheets**
Every article is saved into a Google Sheet with fields like:
* Date
* Title
* Link
* Summary
* Insights Commentary

This becomes your **content library** for future posts.

### **4Ô∏è‚É£ User Requests a Post with ‚Äúgenerate‚Äù**
When the user writes **‚Äúgenerate‚Äù** in Telegram:
* An IF node detects the keyword
* A new AI step creates a LinkedIn-style post
* The post is based on the *most recent* stored article
  (or any logic you configure ‚Äî e.g., random, oldest-first, custom tone, etc.)


### **5Ô∏è‚É£ Workflow Sends Back a Polished LinkedIn Post**
The workflow returns a final, formatted LinkedIn post to the user.
You can also optionally:
* Add hashtags automatically
* Generate multiple options
* Or send the post directly to LinkedIn via integration

# ‚öôÔ∏è Requirements
 **üîë 1. OpenAI Credentials** 
The credential you select will be used in the LLM: Generate Idea & Caption (GPT-4.1) and LLM

**üìä 2. Google Sheets Connection**
Required for storing article data. **Credentials ‚Üí Google ‚Üí Google Sheets OAuth2**

Minimum recommended fields:
* Date
* Title
* Link
* Summary
* Insights Commentary

**The workflow assumes these columns exist.**


**ü§ñ 3. Telegram Bot Setup**
You must:
1. Create a bot via **@BotFather**
2. Add the token inside **Telegram Trigger**
3. Make sure the bot has permission to receive messages

### **üß† 4. Customize the LinkedIn Post Prompt**
Inside ‚ÄúGenerate LinkedIn Post‚Äù node, you can edit:

* Tone (professional, storytelling, punchy, etc.)
* Length
* CTA
* Hashtags
* Personal voice

Change it acording to your needs and style

# **Step 3: LinkedIn post generator on demand**
Once the user asks to "Generate" a post

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
